item.title: GenerativeArt interlude
item.description:
Baravelle spirals: a stupidly simple system

Also: a demonstration of convergent sums

#XQuery #SVG

Blue vortex https://t.co/KiDarYjVzD

Take a regular n-gon. Connect up edge midpoints to get a new, smaller n-gon plus a set of n triangles. Iterate. Order things so that new triangles follow old ones, ending with the last n-gon. Colour mod n, you get spirals. Or: colour sequentially.

Triangle rose https://t.co/cg6Cgof8xN

You don't actually need to use the midpoints. You could instead always use a point x% from the edge start.

Falling into the tornado https://t.co/VjbFOmxdJJ

You don't actually even need to use regular polygons.

Curling wave https://t.co/LuHdFtHFl6

What other fun can we have with this simple system? Well, we can choose to subdivide the triangles as well. (Random colouring scheme.) https://t.co/FjNSryzzSH

Dialing up the subdivision to 11 https://t.co/5caC1B7KWh

Finally, we can take the output and warp it in some way.

The twisted glass https://t.co/50V1zOGU6D

Last one: a less extreme warp.

The alien pinecone https://t.co/Gbk8cuxJXo
item.source:markdown:
Baravelle spirals: a stupidly simple system
Also: a demonstration of convergent sums
#XQuery #SVG
Blue vortex https://t.co/KiDarYjVzD
Take a regular n-gon. Connect up edge midpoints to get a new, smaller n-gon plus a set of n triangles. Iterate. Order things so that new triangles follow old ones, ending with the last n-gon. Colour mod n, you get spirals. Or: colour sequentially.
Triangle rose https://t.co/cg6Cgof8xN
You don't actually need to use the midpoints. You could instead always use a point x% from the edge start.
Falling into the tornado https://t.co/VjbFOmxdJJ
You don't actually even need to use regular polygons.
Curling wave https://t.co/LuHdFtHFl6
What other fun can we have with this simple system? Well, we can choose to subdivide the triangles as well. (Random colouring scheme.) https://t.co/FjNSryzzSH
Dialing up the subdivision to 11 https://t.co/5caC1B7KWh
Finally, we can take the output and warp it in some way.
The twisted glass https://t.co/50V1zOGU6D
Last one: a less extreme warp.
The alien pinecone https://t.co/Gbk8cuxJXo

item.description:
Truth

This whole thread

If, like me, you are old enough to remember the response to HIV, the current approach to monkeypox will seem heartbreakingly familiar https://t.co/EDCIimF4cR
item.source:markdown:
Truth
This whole thread

item.title: GenerativeArt interlude
item.description:
A little application of Snell's Law (n1 sin(胃1)=n2 sin(胃2)) against a grid of materials using Cauchy refraction modeling (n(位) = A + B/位虏)

Mapping various gradients to 位; it doesn't have to be a rainbow

#XQuery #SVG

Lightning strikes https://t.co/wA7yoz40RK

Fractures in the ice https://t.co/KjMrn3Kg6E

The arrangement of materials in the grid doesn't need to be random. Here alternation in columns can channel beams coming from certain angles.

The light trap https://t.co/onUFnRyksK

These aren't particularly realistic materials: I have the dispersion cranked to 11, as it were, and there no absorbance is modeled.

Shimmer https://t.co/pBcPFb2T7F

Sometimes the light gets trapped in a loop, so I had to add an iteration limit.

Five beams enter: four escape (you just have to trust me on that: the splitting hides the fact)

Light trying to escape from the sun https://t.co/v61HAumQbx
item.source:markdown:
A little application of Snell's Law (n1 sin(胃1)=n2 sin(胃2)) against a grid of materials using Cauchy refraction modeling (n(位) = A + B/位虏)
Mapping various gradients to 位; it doesn't have to be a rainbow
#XQuery #SVG
Lightning strikes https://t.co/wA7yoz40RK
Fractures in the ice https://t.co/KjMrn3Kg6E
The arrangement of materials in the grid doesn't need to be random. Here alternation in columns can channel beams coming from certain angles.
The light trap https://t.co/onUFnRyksK
These aren't particularly realistic materials: I have the dispersion cranked to 11, as it were, and there no absorbance is modeled.
Shimmer https://t.co/pBcPFb2T7F
Sometimes the light gets trapped in a loop, so I had to add an iteration limit.
Five beams enter: four escape (you just have to trust me on that: the splitting hides the fact)
Light trying to escape from the sun https://t.co/v61HAumQbx

item.title: GenerativeArt interlude
item.description:
Mazes

More fun with the Wave Function Collapse algorithm

#XQuery #SVG https://t.co/E9UbqlWP5E

I run the algorithm in a way that the individual tiles are drawn as geometric objects that I can manipulate in various ways with my libraries before rendering out as SVG.

Warped https://t.co/y5lXu1C8pd

The chalice https://t.co/2OqG2qTXQy
item.source:markdown:
Mazes
More fun with the Wave Function Collapse algorithm
#XQuery #SVG https://t.co/E9UbqlWP5E
I run the algorithm in a way that the individual tiles are drawn as geometric objects that I can manipulate in various ways with my libraries before rendering out as SVG.
Warped https://t.co/y5lXu1C8pd
The chalice https://t.co/2OqG2qTXQy

item.title: GenerativeArt interlude
item.description:
Fun with the Wave Function Collapse algorithm (cf https://t.co/WwfX4DRhC0)

#XQuery #SVG https://t.co/Qmy6rvJC6U

This is the simple tiling variation, where you define some base tiles, their symmetries, and some L to R adjacency rules https://t.co/sSMBoK5VmM

For the gradient tiling I needed to extend the ported algorithm to introduce a couple of new symmetry types

You can get very different looks depending on whether the gradient is sequential, circular, divergent, random, or split https://t.co/hXrDV9R1KI

A random gradient https://t.co/9XGAtrUK4k
item.source:markdown:
Fun with the Wave Function Collapse algorithm (cf https://t.co/WwfX4DRhC0)
#XQuery #SVG https://t.co/Qmy6rvJC6U
This is the simple tiling variation, where you define some base tiles, their symmetries, and some L to R adjacency rules https://t.co/sSMBoK5VmM
For the gradient tiling I needed to extend the ported algorithm to introduce a couple of new symmetry types
You can get very different looks depending on whether the gradient is sequential, circular, divergent, random, or split https://t.co/hXrDV9R1KI
A random gradient https://t.co/9XGAtrUK4k

item.description: It's like the Oscar's in reverse: first the play-off music, then the speech thanking everyone under the sun, then the picture #NASA #JWST

item.description:
True story: I was once on a team that was losing 6-0 at half-time in WFA cup match

We ended up winning that game 7-6

Not that I'd take odds on that happening today (or any day, really)
item.source:markdown:
True story: I was once on a team that was losing 6-0 at half-time in WFA cup match

#EURO2022 斤
